Reviews summary
This summary was created by AI, based on recent reviews.
Powered by AI
The Taj Ganges Varanasi garners praise for its cleanliness, with guests consistently impressed by the spotless rooms and pristine premises. Many travelers commend the hotel for its exceptional service, noting the staff's attentive and personalized care. While the location offers a peaceful haven close to key attractions, some guests find the rooms small and in need of renovation. The hotel's amenities, including a luxurious spa and live music, along with its enriching cultural atmosphere, are frequently celebrated. However, opinions are mixed on value, with some finding the hotel overpriced.

Karthik wrote a review Nov 2020
Spark in the Park!
With lot of options to choose from the Oldest City to stay! and also keeping in mind for the safety with covid guidelines finalised The Taj ganges at the destination for a short detour for the weekend.The location was little far from the ghats but in the heart of the city. The management has put in their full effort to adhere to the safety guidelines from the entry to the hotel and everything else. The minute efforts put should be appreciated with access to sanitizers in places frequently touched. The team from the reception also made the check in process quick.The rooms felt slightly smaller compared to other places at this rate. But the rooms were beautiful,shiny and filled with good vibes. The breakfast at the Chowk wasn't as expected with very limited options, Food of Varuna was very good and we enjoyed it. Special thanks for the staff from The Varuna and housekeeping to make our stay good!

TapanKB wrote a review Mar 2020
Minneapolis, Minnesota
Superb Service and peace in the chaotic holy city
We stayed 3 nights on our trip at this hotel. Its setting makes it a abode of peace with huge grounds in the middle of this chaotic holy city.
Though, there were some Indians staying, it caters to the overseas visitors and tour groups. The rooms are well appointed, though ours had a drainage problem in the shower area, which was fixed on the second request.
The Coffee shop called the Chowk had high quality food and the serving staff, where very efficient and anxious to serve us. A delightful and restful experience.
The foot bath was a nice touch with rose petals in warm water to soothe our feet after walking thru the lanes of this city.

TowerTwo wrote a review Jan 2020
Blackpool, United Kingdom
Good hotel, excellent service
Had a great room here, newly decorated with an amazing bathroom, bath as well as shower. Very well lit, no problem reading as there is in some hotels.

But it was the service that was remarkable here. Everyone from room cleaner to senior management was intent on ensuring everything was perfect for guests. At dinner five different people asked if the food was alright in the space of five minutes. Clearly a culture of excellent customer service at this hotel.

Travel-1-Facts wrote a review May 2020
Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada
Don't mail a letter at this hotel
I stayed several nights, and the various hotel staff were helpful.

They have good security staff checking people and luggage before entering the facility.

The business center was upstairs near the office staff desks and had a fast internet connection.

Lots of food selection at the various Buffet stations, with friendly staff.

The rooms have nice amenities and attentive staff

DO not mail a letter in the lobby mail box. I bought stamps from the concierge desk staff for my letter. It has been three months and never received, so who knows what they do with the letters you mail in the hotel.

Response from Vijay_Shrikent_TGVNS, General Manager at Taj Ganges Varanasi
Responded 10 Jun 2020
Dear Guest, Thank you for choosing to stay at Taj Ganges Varanasi, and for sharing your feedback on TripAdvisor. It was kind of you to take time out to share the experience of your visit, especially during these troubled times, and we are glad that the hotels facilities and services met with your approval. Food and beverages are part of our daily celebration of life, and appreciating this, we are pleased to learn that you enjoyed our buffet offerings, and our colleagues were able to deliver upon your expectations. I am grateful to you for your kind, frank and objective feedback and would also like to reassure you of our commitment to our guests, and to the sense of Indian hospitality which we have always typified. All postcards/letters which are received in our Lobby Letter Box are collected daily in the morning by the bellboy and are deposited in the Government letter box (Indian Post box) which is inside our premises. From here, all the letters/postcards are collected by the Postman on a daily basis. We did check with the local administrative department of the Indian Post office regarding the dispatch of the postcards collected from Taj Ganges, Varanasi for the month of February,2020, and were informed by the concerned department that all of them had already been dispatched from the Varanasi office. We presume owing to the Corona virus outbreak globally, there could be a delay in the processing of these postcards from India, as a lockdown was announced here in March 2020. During the lockdown period, only essential items were being transported, however we will persist in our efforts to obtain an answer, and regret the inconvenience caused. I was glad to note that this did not detract from the overall stay experience, where you have been most kind with your appreciation. Our efforts to get in touch have been unsuccessful, and we understand and appreciate that you must be keeping busy. Therefore, may I request you to kindly share your preferred email address and contact number, for us to get in touch with you in case we receive any further update from our local Post office in this regard. It would be wonderful also to learn that the cards written by you have reached their intended recipients. It is our sincerest wish and hope that you, and your family, relatives, friends, colleagues, and their families emerge unscathed, and stay well and safe during this unfortunate period. We look forward to hearing from you and to be of service again, and ensuring that you experience our best hospitality on all your visits. Once again, thank you for your feedback, and please do let me know of any assistance that I may be of personally, in future. Jitender Kumar Bharihoke wrote a review Feb 2021
Mumbai, India
Grand Taj hospitality
The large hearted Taj hospitality makes you feel at home in any new city. I must say that the Taj Ganges more than lived upto this expectation.

We had a memorable family trip in December 2020 and thanks to the General Manager Mr. Vivek Sharma and his entire team we had a great memorable stay. They well anticipated all our needs right from meeting our dietary requirements and making arrangement for visits to the ghats, temples or other tourist places like Sarnath.
The restaurant food and breakfast spread was fabulous. We would make a special mention of F&B head Mr. Vikas Nagar, Restaurant manager Mr Rajiv Sharma and their entire team Mr. Kaustav. Mr Mangal, Mr. Navneet, Mr. Dharmender, Mr. Abhimanyu , Ms Akanksha and Mr. Jitendra, Mr. Anil and Ms Ananya for taking great care of our dietary needs and giving us a taste of local ethnic delicacies. Please do not miss the Banarasi Thandai at the breakfast and you will find the restaurant team more than willing to ensure that your taste buds are pampered.
We also want to make a special mention of the concierge desk headed by Mr. Amar and Shashank for going out of the way to ensure that we go back with great memories of Banaras. Our driver Mr. Kishan and guide Mr. Shashank seem to know every thing about Benaras and were ever willing to answer to the curiosity of my son. They were always on their toes to ensure our safety while we were on the ghats or crowded lanes of Benaras.
This trip has left a great mark on us and we will want come back as soon as we get another chance. Right from reservation, to check in and check out the people have been fabulous leaving us with a great impression about the Taj Ganges team and a strong desire to come back.
The gym manager Mr. Praveen Nair would be ever willing to organise games and rackets even late in the evening if we wanted to play a game or two. Thanks for maintaining all hygiene and precautions. Every day we would end with a hot water foot massage organised by the housekeeping folks in the room where in they would place large copper bowls with salts and rose water to help us release our travel fatigue.

Thank you guys for taking such great care of us and we will be back soon.

Jitender, Urmi and Aarav

Hospitality par excellence
Taj Ganges and Nadesar Palace for me are institutions in itself on hospitality. Staff there always display a great level of service in making your stay homely and personal. Each stay the bar goes higher and higher. A lot to learn from the people who works tirelessly to make your stay memorable. Hotels General Manager- Mr Vivek makes it a point to personally greet the guests and make sure their stay become comfortable & Mr Ananth Gaddala, who is always there to help at any point of time.
I would like to thank the entire staff of Taj Varanasi for yet another memorable stay.

Date of stay: January 2021Trip type: Travelled on business
